results.title: Fraggle songs
results.brief_description: Fraggle Rock was a very successful television series from 1983-1988 emanating from the producers of the much-loved Muppet Show but featuring a whole new cast of Jim Henson’s muppets, including Doc and his dog Sprocket, furry little creatures called Fraggles who share their home Fraggle Rock with other even smaller creatures known as the Doozers and the giant Gorgs who like to think they rule Fraggle Rock. These wonderful characters all inhabit the magical fairy-tale world of Fraggle Rock where the most amazing things can and do happen. “Fraggle songs” successfully brings together through music and song, the lovable Fraggle Rock characters in a warm and highly amusing story designed to entertain the whole family, with original music and lyrics composed by Phillip Balsam and Dennis Lee.

results.title: Fracture of the cervical spine: crutchfield tongs reduction
results.brief_description: A silent film with intertitles showing the way crutchfield tongs reduction works to cure a patient who has fractured his cervical spine after diving into shallow water. The initial operation in which the head is drilled is shown performed on a cadaver.

results.title: Fractions
results.brief_description: An animated film which introduces the symbols for halves, quarters and thirds. Clearly and simply outlines the difference between whole numbers and fractions.

results.title: Fra Diavolo
results.creator_credit: Official Films, Richfield Operatic Films, George Richfield and Francesco Cancellieri
results.brief_description: A condensed version of Aubor’s comic opera in three acts. The film preserves the dramatic continuity of the complete opera and includes the major scenes and musical passages. Photographed on the stage of the opera house of Rome, sung in Italian by La Scala Opera Company with Nino Adami in the role of Fra Diavolo.

results.title: Foxbat and the Mimi
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and John Skibinski
results.brief_description: A storm forces a flying fox to take shelter in a cave, something he regrets when cave spirits attempt to capture him. A film by John Skibinski. Also available as a compilation with “The Huge adventures of Trevor the cat”.

results.title: Fox and the jug
results.creator_credit: Official Films, Czechoslovak State Film and St Latal
results.brief_description: An animated version of the fable. A sly fox is looking for an easy dinner. An innocent looking jug upsets his plans and the little red rooster lives to run another day.

results.title: Fox and his friends = Faustrecht der freiheit
results.creator_credit: Tango-Film, City-Film, GmbH and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: The only one of Fassbinder’s films to explicitly centre on gay male relationships, this film tells the story of a young, working class, unemployed lottery winner who is exploited, with tragic consequences, by his new-found ‘middle class’ friends. This is one of the director’s best socially critical melodramas, focussing on a victim who conspires in his own victimisation, and using the framework of a love story to lay bare the mechanisms of class exploitation. The film’s avoidance of specifically gay issues, and its bleak representation of gay lifestyles, outraged many in the gay community at the time of its release. Now, however, Fassbinder’s presumption that gay men are fundamentally the same as everyone else looks startlingly modern. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fourteenth Biennial Conference - British Empire Service League
results.creator_credit: University of Melbourne and Returned Services League of Australia
results.brief_description: Documents the Fourteenth Biennial Conference of the British Empire Service League held at the Albert Hall in Canberra in 1958. Shows footage of the Queen Mother placing a wreath on the Canberra War Memorial and opening the Conference.
